Student Support Resources

Academic Advisors do more than provide resources and answer questions for students in need. They help you set academic goals, help you develop a career plan, and connect you with resources at the College. Your Academic Advisor is here to support you as you pursue your educational endeavors at Algonquin College.

Topics

  • Student Support Resources
  • Pantone Books
  • Hardware Requirements
  • DesignThinkers
  • Assessment
  • Admin Pages
  • Submitting Assignments on Brightspace

Centre for Accessible Learning (CAL)

Location: E341
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/cal/
Hours: N/A
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7200
E-mail: cal@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Individualized accommodation plans
  • Learning Strategist Support/Assistive Technology Lab/sign language interpreters
  • Computerized note taking
  • Test room services & accommodations
  • Intake Assessment Advisor

  • The Print Shop

Employment Support Centre

Location: E341
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/employment/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:30AM-4:45PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7200
E-mail: employment@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Job search skills & interview coaching
  • Résumé, portfolio, cover letter coaching
  • On-campus recruiting; job search resources; job postings on and off campus
  • HireAC for online job postings

Experienced Worker Centre

Location: A214
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/ewc/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 9:00AM-4:30PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7127
E-mail: N/A
Services:

  • Assistance to any potential non- direct considering a return to school or re-training. EWC Intake and Referral Consultants match clients skills, interests, and career goals to best fit programs and related funding.
  • Information & assistance with all Employment Ontario programs, including Second Career which provides up to $28,000 to adults in career transition (unemployed, working part-time, end of contract, etc)
  • Assistance gathering relevant information for funding applications and requirements
  • Access to current local labor market

Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:30AM-4:30PM
Phone: 613-727-0002
E-mail: financialaid@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Government student loan programs (OSAP & Out-of-Province)
  • Bursaries
  • Financial Assistance

SA Food Cupboard

Location: C033
Website: www.algonquinsa.com/services/food-cupboard/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 9:00AM-4:00PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7711
E-mail: clarkj1@algonquincollege.com

  • Provides students in financial need with food and basic necessities
  • Access is limited to once a month and on an emergency need basis
  • Accepts donations of pre-packaged and non-perishable items
  • Must have valid student card and bring reusable bag

Food Services

Location: D111
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/food-services/

E-mail: bellc@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Banquets & events
  • Meal plans

Mamidosewin Centre (Aboriginal Student Centre)

Location: E122
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/mamidosewin/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:00AM-4:30PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7186
E-mail: N/A
Services:

  • Aboriginal Counsellor, Student Success Specialist, Employment Coach, Events Coordinator, visiting elders
  • Cree School Board Liaison
  • Culturally relevant support services; links to community services, activities, ceremonies teachings, traditional healing
  • Social gathering space, kitchenette, printer

Office of the Ombudsman

Location: E112
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/ombuds/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:30AM-4:30PM
(closed 12:00PM-1:00PM)
Phone: 613-727-4723x.6835
E-mail: ombuds@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Safe space for students to seek advice, assistance and pursue any college-related concern
  • Provides information on College policies, the rights and responsibilities of students in College situations
  • Directs complaints and inquiries
  • Investigates complaints, as necessary

Student Association (SA)

Location: E114
Website: www.algonquinsa.com
Hours: Mon-Thurs, 8:30AM-7:00PM
Fri, 8:30AM-5:00PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.7711
E-mail: studentsassociation@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Health & dental coverage
  • Free CV copies, color report printing (USB file; 20pp max), free faxing ( job search Canada/US, academic-related, international for international students only)
  • Emergency line, tax prep, funding for grad/clubs/field trips
  • Observatory pub (courtesy phone)
  • Group study room booking

Location: C037
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/transfer-options
Hours: By Appointment

Student Learning Centre

Location: C259
Website: www.algonquincollege.com/slc/
Hours: Mon-Fri, 10:00AM-6:00PM
Sat-Sun, 10:00AM-4:00PM
Phone: 613-727-4723x.6661
E-mail: slc@algonquincollege.com
Services:

  • Workshops on study skills, research and writing, citations, technology, and career preparedness Peer-Tutoring:
  • Students meet with upper level students; one- on-one academic assistance
  • 48hr advanced booking required; 24hr cancellation notice required
  • Cost - $8 per hour (financial support available)

Coaching:

  • Students meet for one-on-one or small group coaching on the fundamentals of a subject
  • Subjects include writing, English (as a second language), computers, math, anatomy/physiology, and chemistry
  • By appointment or drop-in hours
  • Cost – Paid for by the Library

  • Room E304e for CAL and remote assessments
